intro: Lychnis apetala var. kingii, commonly known as King's honesty, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the carnation family (Caryophyllaceae) and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant produces small, white, disk-like fruits called capsules, which are a distinctive feature of the species. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soils, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and borders. Its botanical features make it both ornamental and ecologically valuable in native plant gardens.
